headline: Wells Fargo Reshapes Costs As CEO Pay Rises And Consumer Arm Grows
summary: Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC) announces further layoffs as part of an ongoing shift in its operations. The bank plans significant real estate divestitures, trimming office and property exposure. The CEO receives a 28% pay increase, which the board links to performance metrics and consumer business growth. For you as an investor, these moves point to a bank still reshaping itself after prior controversies, with cost structure and footprint under active review. Wells Fargo remains a major US retail...
